website_summaries.verdict: An excellent pair of blunt-tip emergency scissors for a low price.
cons: Contrary to the product specs and most reviews, a few buyers say the scissors don't cut well

customer_reviews.title: Good for temporary use only
customer_reviews.text: My son was hit by a car and got severly banged up...broken bones and all. After being discharged from the hospital my husband and I have to clean his wounds and change his bandages twice a day. About 5 days in and these shears have already lost their luster. They started out cutting like a hot knife thru butter but now it is forced and difficult. I ended up wrapping gauze all around the handle/finger holes because the cut is so rough and takes so long that they hurt my fingers every time I have to use them, which again, is twice a day. I definitely WOULD NOT recommend these for long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Kriss

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE IF YOU NEED “TRAUMA” shears.
customer_reviews.text: Worst pair of trauma shears I’ve ever bought. You could buy a children’s full $2 pair of scissors and they would cut better. I literally couldn’t even cut through a tank top with these. I’m a trauma nurse, and I’ve attempted to use these 3 times, and every time I end up tearing the clothes with my hands and get better results. The blade also feels very flimsy and not snug, so maybe my pair are just defective, but dang, these were so useless. I’d send them back, but it’s not worth the shipping cost.
customer_reviews.author: William Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Worst scissors ever
customer_reviews.text: I cant believe all the positive reviews. i must have definitely got a defective product because they couldn't cut through 3/4" nylon rope. Really disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: chaz.photo

customer_reviews.title: Not pleased,,,
customer_reviews.text: Item is as another has described... I'm not sure if i just happened to get a bad pair, but I tried to test these on cutting a regular cotton shirt and they would not cut. So in an emergency situation, I would not be able to rely on these. I'm hoping that the seller gets in touch with me to resolve the issue as I feel it just must have been a quality control issue.
customer_reviews.author: blangton16

customer_reviews.title: These were completely dull on delivery - but a new pair was way better
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: The customer service for these is incredible. Within a day of posting my review they had two pairs of new shears on the way to me. The new ones work perfectly, I must have just gotten a pair from a bad batch. Definitely worth the gamble of maybe getting a bad out since the customer service is so good. These shears were absolutely terrible. I bought them due to the excellent rating but they would not even cut through stockinette - only frayed it barely. Very embarrassing for a med student, would NOT recommend. Not sure if I received a put from a bad batch but I wouldn’t risk it...
customer_reviews.author: Allison Williams

customer_reviews.title: Sheers that don't sheer
customer_reviews.text: Trauma sheers have pretty much one job: cutting. These don't cut, I threw them away. Update: the company replaced them and refunded my purchase. The others seem to well although I haven't used them in the field yet. I was pleasantly surprised by their customer service and desire to make the situation right again.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: *****Update***** Survivorware went above and beyond when they realized I had an issue. They immediately shipped me out new shears without me even asking. Any company with that kind of customer service has to be pretty great! ***End update*** These shears are a little rough. I haven’t used them in an emergency yet but just me function testing them concerned me a little.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great product and company
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with these. Our vet told us to get a pair for changing bandage on our German Shepherd's leg. For the price they seem to be a very good quality and we are also pleased with the company. Got a personalized email from company rep following through to make sure we were happy with them. Would highly recommend this company to family and friends for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Ellyooo

customer_reviews.title: I liked the look and feel of these but they weren’t ...
customer_reviews.text: Edit: excellent customer service. After posting my review (which I didn’t think was too terrible), they gave me a full refund, sent two complimentary pairs of the scissors along with a hand written note. Really impressed by the amount of thought put into keeping their customers happy! I liked the look and feel of these but they weren’t so great at cutting, even through easy materials like very thing plastic and every day items we encounter in the hospital setting. It’s okay though, I lost them pretty fast and bought a different pair.
customer_reviews.author: zita

customer_reviews.title: Spend more money and get a better product.
customer_reviews.text: My first pair worked great. This pair were bent upon arrival and have never been able to cut through anything. I didn’t realize it until I was on scene of a fall and when I went to cut the shirt off of the patient, the scissors just rolled over the fabric and did nothing. A complete waste of $8. My next pair will be Raptors and I’ll hope not to lose them on a scene.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Spinach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool you hope you never need to use.....
customer_reviews.text: These shears do exactly what you want them to. I tested them on a pair of old jeans that we're going to be thrown away anyways. Went from cuff at the leg all the way to the waist band in less then 10 seconds. Hot knife through butter if you will. I put these in my kit and hope I never need to use them again but if I do, I am glad they are there.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable in my hand
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and another brand based on price, with the intention of replacing medical shears in my trauma pack. These did not cut tape or gauze as well as some of my other shears probably because the serrated edge is shallower (which seems to reduce the cutting edge). They do work well in my tool box for general cutting and trimming so I'm keeping them there.
customer_reviews.author: Lalawman

customer_reviews.title: I liked them, but they didn't work in the moment!
customer_reviews.text: When I tested them out they had worked, guess only if I took my time, but we had to do some simulations for my EMT class and were being timed on the scene. In the middle of the scene when trying to use my shears they would not cut through the clothing. and made us lose time which looked bad teacher saw I was struggling with ti and was nice enough to donate some better shears that cut real quickly compared to these! Definitely not buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I actually use these scissors to cut the tape bandages that support my broken toe on my left foot. I was having a hard time using regular scissors to get through them, looked on Amazon, and these were one of the first that popped up and good reviews. They are very well made and make cutting so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Marty C.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any medpack
customer_reviews.text: I love these, not too heavy and look cool. I do a fair amount of backpacking and these are always in the medical pack. They cut nylon webbing, 550 cord ect and do it with relative ease.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Neef

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was expecting, but not for their intended use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace an old set of trauma shears (advertised on TV many years ago as "miracle scissors") that kept getting misplaced. I use them for various cutting tasks around the house, where one's better paper-cutting scissors would be ill-suited or ruin those blades, and I can recommend them highly in that regard. They work wonderfully for everything for which I've needed them. It should be noted that the pivot will be a bit tight until they've had a little bit of breaking in time and been well used...not docking a star for that, it's just something to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J.

customer_reviews.title: Can do some cutting
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet, but they seem dangerous in the sense that it can really do some cutting! It's big too, seems very durable, and slides smoothly when opening and closing. I'm saving this for emergencies, such as if I were in flooded area and couldn't get my seatbelt off, I'm pretty sure this will help cut through the seatbelt. Unfortunately, this has happened in my family with a morbid result.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.text: This is the least sturdy pair of Trauma scissors I have ever used. I bought two pair - one for me and one for my wife and we both agree that these trauma shears feel like they are poor quality. In use they lose their edge in a matter of a couple of days. Neither my wife nor I feel that we could recommend these shears.
customer_reviews.author: TheOldPhart

customer_reviews.title: So-so quality scissors
customer_reviews.text: This scissor is just your standard, cheap paramedic scissor. The good: No flash along the inner seam of the handle, which is annoying and can be painful if you’re trying to cut through thick jeans, etc. They were delivered on time. The so-so: There are higher quality scissors out there but these are only,well, so-so. They are a step up from the horrible scissors you sometimes find that seem like they were made in a blacksmith’s shop 100 years ago, but they are far from a high quality, smoothly cutting scissor. I’ll use them until I lose them, but I won’t be sorry when they’re gone.
customer_reviews.author: ThisIsNotMyRealName

customer_reviews.title: Great scissors
customer_reviews.text: I bought these scissors for clinicals in nursing school, they are great for what I use them for! I’ve gotten many compliments and questions on where I bought them from by nurses. My only complaint is that they get stuck sometimes and I have to tug pretty hard to open them.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonJesi

customer_reviews.title: Durable, effective, and for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: These shears are up to par. I see other medics that go for the fancier stuff, but for me I just need something durable and do the job I require of it. And they do - they cut through leather, plastic, and tough materials and saves critical time that would be wasted with a cheap pair of shears. For the price you pay there aren't better options of quality.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ching

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Trauma Shears
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace an old pair that had given up. So far, they are a good pair of scissors that haven't let me down, but I don't use them consistently or in trauma situations as the might be needed by others. But for what I use them for, they are a good buy and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Caminante

customer_reviews.title: Great Scissors great for everything
customer_reviews.text: "They worked perfectly I thought I'm going give these a real run so I got an aluminum can turned it on its side and cut it with no problem then I turn the upright cut the top were you open it and cut the top no problem no slipping of the blades no dulling of the blades. After I cut the can I got some paper and cut the paper perfectly these will last years to come."
customer_reviews.author: John Bazan

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product, Loose and Dull. Failed.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible product. First time use was on a patient with multiple gunshots to the chest. I went to cut off the patient’s clothes and these shears couldn’t even gnaw through a T-shirt. Ran to get my old ones that these were supposed to replace and they did a much better job. Also, I hang shears on a retractable keychain that I hang on the front of my scrubs because I need them frequently and they just flop open and can’t stay closed. Dull, loose, floppy, poorly made and they failed at their only purpose when a person’s life was on the line. These are garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp enough for the ER
customer_reviews.text: I work in the ER and these scissors can barely cut the plastic off of saline bags. Would not recommend for anything other than thin plastic/plastic patient bands.
customer_reviews.author: L R

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: I'm a floor nurse and while they cut great, they are just too big for me to carry. It's bulky and so it takes up a lot of space in my scrub pocket. I should had paid attention to the size before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Little_Huskie02012

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this product
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. The first few times i used it it worked good but then it did not cut when the jaws were opened fully. I use it to cut bed straps and cast underpadding material and various paper/plastic products. basically anything in the operating room. I ended up giving it to another nurse i know. I still have the other pair i bought and will try those also.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo Nieves

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These are great. They are durable and do a great job. The shipping was fast and the customer support was really great. I didn’t have any issues but the owner of the company reached out just to make sure I was satisfied. Great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: M.Russell

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but not great shears
customer_reviews.text: I only bought these because I had to for work, knew I didn't ever need to use them but had to have them to check a box, and was looking for the least expensive option. They're kind of cheaply made, blades rock a bit back and forth rather than engaging cleanly. You get what you pay for, though.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Jane

customer_reviews.title: and the handles are comfortable, even when cutting through thick cardboard
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of these shears and their frustration free packaging made so that I could open my OTHER packages for items I bought form other sellers at the same time! The two halves are bound tightly, and the handles are comfortable, even when cutting through thick cardboard. These are all going in first aid kits, and as an ex emt/firefighter, I'm happy to carry them!
customer_reviews.author: Yank12

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp at all
customer_reviews.text: Not sharp at all. Even after sharpening with knife sharpener I’ve had to use other cheaper scissors to finish or start the job. The pin holder of the handles is flimsy and this causes the blades to open and rotate all the way so the scissors are backwards most of the times. Not a good pair of shears.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Mendez

customer_reviews.title: A smart purchase for superior shears.
customer_reviews.text: Wow Survivewear brought the goods when they came up with this product. Great value for a superior product. Everything you’d expect out of more expensive shears at a price point that you will use them, they will quickly become your go-to shears as your tool of choice. The price point and the personal support from the owner along with the quality makes this a sure win purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RockSolidReviews

customer_reviews.title: Great scissors
customer_reviews.text: Use these everyday for my nursing job, they never disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: steph

customer_reviews.title: Durable Sheers
customer_reviews.text: These are heavy-duty trauma sheers. We haven't used them for heavy-duty trauma, but I'm sure they'd do the trick. We use them mostly now for our own first aid kit, which has seen its fair share of at-home injuries.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: An outstanding general use product.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this scissors to have a dependable cutter handy in my bathroom for whatever purpose was needed. I am extremely pleased with this product. It does everything I expected with ease and safety. I highly recommend this item, and the service and shipment was also excellent.
customer_reviews.author: W. Reel

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting better quality based on the reviews
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: While the quality of these shears didn't meet my expectations, their customer service team went above and beyond to make things right. I would buy other products from this vendor. ___________________________________________________________________________________________________ I bought these as a more affordable, back-up pair of shears. I was expecting better quality based on the reviews; however, they seem quite flimsy. In the future, I will spend an additional ~$5 and get shears that would be more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Luis S

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with these scissors
customer_reviews.text: I have been a nurse for over a decade and typically use the standard silver trauma sheers at work. I an left handed and sometimes have difficulty using scissors but these are amazing! good quality, cuts very easily. I would definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Gets The Job Done
customer_reviews.text: They're Trauma Shears, they cut stuff. What more do we really expect? Quality seems fine, cuts all of the normal items as expected. Haven't had too much hands-on with them yet but so far nothing to be disappointed about. Will update review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a busy floor nurse and I just wanted a no non sense strong reliable and affordable pair of bandage scissors. These were perfect. I can tell the company that sells these cares about quality. I'll definitely be looking to them for future medical supply purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Strong, yet afforadable shears...
customer_reviews.text: These medical shears seem (haven't needed to use them as yet...thankfully) to be sturdy and sharp enough to perform in the field in tasks related to medical emergencies. Glad to have them in my trauma kit.
customer_reviews.author: Fremy

customer_reviews.title: Mehhh
customer_reviews.text: These scissors cut but they are warped (?) and only the tips of the scissors meet forcing you to angle them in a specific manner just to use them to cut things. They’re still usable but it is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced, satisfied with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I liked that the shears were lightweight. They fit my hands, however I have smaller hands. I think someone with large hands may struggle a bit. They were sharp and cut through material easily. The plastic handles gave me pause, as they were a bit flimsy, however they held up just fine. Price is very reasonable. Overall I was pleased with my purchase. I used shears to cut through soft cast I had on my left wrist. I fell on the ice and had to rewrap wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: High quality surgical shears
customer_reviews.text: I have on going medical issues and these shears are the best I ever used. It feels comfortable in the hand and the blade slices like butter. A must have!
customer_reviews.author: Shaptai S.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Shears
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately, I haven't had to use these shears yet for their intended purpose! I bought multiple pairs so I can keep one in each car and one in the house. I have also explained to the wife she is able to use them as utility shears for whatever needs cutting. They look and feel very well made and I expect they will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Charles De Long

customer_reviews.title: Medical shears
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect. I lost mymedical shears & was looking for replacement. These are so much nicer. Not to heavy just right weight. So much easier to use for cutting bandages off.
customer_reviews.author: TAZ

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed, excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I have not used them, but I can tell these trauma shears are top-notch. I feel confident having them as part of my blowout kits if - God forbid - I ever have to utilize the kit to save my life or the lives of others.
customer_reviews.author: A. B. Barham

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price for a cheap product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shear b/c of lower price and many positive reviews. I am working as an ER tech at a level 2 trauma. I used this shear for two days and had to find another shear to replace it. First it did not cut as good as the shear my hopistal provided shear. Second the metal used to produce this shear is weak and feel inferior to many other shears used by coworkers.
customer_reviews.author: camry 2013 se

customer_reviews.title: As advertised, well made, easy to keep clean
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, size fits my large hands, they will certainly cut through lots of stuff but we keep these in the first aid/wound care kit.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Garbage and will not cut you out of a wet paper bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my friend dropped mine in a lake. I figured they had good reviews but i am very disappointed in these as I have used many different brands and have all been quality. That being said I tested these on an old T-shirt as I do with all my shears and these wouldn’t cut. I even tried to cut 20lb braid fishing line and it wouldn’t even cut that. Hands down these are a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: adam walton

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these.
customer_reviews.text: Worst trauma shears I've ever used, fresh out of the box I brought them to work in the ER and my first trauma comes and I can't get his clothes off with my brand new shears, and the Trauma surgeon stares at me in frustration because was taking too long. I've had similar pairs work, but this one could hardly do anything at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Osteria

customer_reviews.title: Great scissors
customer_reviews.text: Just used this to take off a bandage around my dog's paw. The vet did a VERY good job to keep this wrap secure and I wouldn't have been able to get it off without these scissors. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Marci Liroff

customer_reviews.title: good shears
customer_reviews.text: not the cheapest on the market but price is decent. it does what it’s supposed to do. blades appear sharp. the shears itself is not too light making it flimsy. can’t say anything about durability yet since i only had it for a week. but, i think it would hold up *fingers crossed*
customer_reviews.author: artemis

customer_reviews.title: Need more
customer_reviews.text: I loved these scissors, wish they came as a 3 pack and with a decal. My scissors were picked up and I wasn’t able to fully enjoy them.
customer_reviews.author: Jose O Ruedas

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and heavier than expected
customer_reviews.text: I say heavier than expected bc I never bought or seen shears before. Bought for nursing school and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: LucidWays

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Did not cut through my bandage dressing as well as I thought they would. But they did cut better than the messages I had when using.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline M. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not the best either
customer_reviews.text: Got this for when I’m at the hospital and would have to say these are probably only good for normal use like regular scissors. I would use this to cut corrugated tubing but wouldn’t use it for an emergency situation. Tried cutting through a penny as shown and it barely made a dent or scratch even. Quality is just ok but you get what you pay for I guess. Maybe it’s just me.. anyway still searching for a dependable pair..
customer_reviews.author: Julieanne

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I could not believe the quality for such a reasonable price. I run an animal rescue and we go through a lot of bandage change shears. I can tell these will outlast the rest!
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Great company
customer_reviews.text: This company is amazing. I had a shipping issue and they worked with me to ensure I received my product. They were very kind and respectful. The shears are really lightweight. I have a few pairs now (one in my backpack, scrubs, and car). They clip right through jeans and sweaters, I like them!
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I got these shears and to my surprise they were very high grade and super sharp. They worked very well with cutting bandages for my daughter. She loves to run and jump and always gets scrapes and cuts. I used the scissors to cut gauze and bandaids. They worked amazing! Definitely glad i bought them! Such a great price too! I will be using these for years to come and will recommend them to all friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic A.

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp and sturdy. Unfortunately, I didn’t get to see how long they last, because they “disappeared” after the first night I used them in the ER. So, someone else really liked them too I guess!
customer_reviews.author: sarah holbrook

customer_reviews.title: They are a little stiff to use at first.
customer_reviews.text: I use the shears to cut bandages away from areas that need to be re-bandaged. Two or three layers of gauze, with some padding (such as ABD pads) and some tape are difficult to cut with even bandage scissors. These work GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: BWH

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Product shipped on time, and the seller was very respectful, with a safe-minded goal in providing buyers with first aid information, along with the shears. It is everyone's responsibility to understand basic first aid at a minimum. With understanding first aid, we should have the tools to succeed. Will buy again from this seller, and I would recommend her to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hospital workers go to
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of dressing changes as a resident and these are pretty good. They work well and I dont feel horrible if I lose them, like many of the ones before
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Seem to work well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two to fit in a couple IFAKs I am building. They are full sized, but relatively light, and when I tested them on cotton t shirts they cut well.
customer_reviews.author: JPC

customer_reviews.title: Love the color but I have already scratched them up ...
customer_reviews.text: Everyone is jelous of my black scissors. Love the color but I have already scratched them up pretty good by opening medication to pour on the field(I work in the OR). But overall they do thier intended purpose and are super distinctive so if someone has stolen them they are easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: Mel mohan-timm

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: The shears are effective, cheap, and functional. I am pleased with this purchase, and recommend them as the equivalent of any I've used or better.
customer_reviews.author: Peace

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my fiancee, she's a nurse. She works in the OR and opens dozens of packages each day. A co-worker suggested investing in these to save her from getting carpal tunnel. She thinks they're awesome, and uses them all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M Stein

customer_reviews.title: Best Quality Scissors I have found
customer_reviews.text: These scissors will not disappoint. They get the job done effortlessly, and seem to stay sharp. You can’t find this quality at a better price. Shipping and follow up by their company is very impressive. I loved the penlight they sent too. Thank you Surviveware!
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Precision tool.
customer_reviews.text: I am in awe of the performance, they are without a doubt the best medical grade shears I've owned. They are the perfect fit to my field medical bag.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Tollett

customer_reviews.title: Shears for my First Aid Kits
customer_reviews.text: I keep 3 first kits handy and needed scissors for each kit. Found these scissors at a reasonable price. I purchased 3. Tried cutting different material like cloth, cardboard and rope. They cut thru them with no problem. Seems sturdy and a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: VideoGuy

customer_reviews.title: ... actually purchased these not for first aid or anything like that. I got them because I needed a ...
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased these not for first aid or anything like that. I got them because I needed a little kit for work to carry around my most needed items, and these shears were the perfect size for the pouch. Very happy with them they came sharp, and feel good in the hand. If I need another pair, will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Customer service has been great, been contacted multiple times since the purchase to ...
customer_reviews.text: Customer service has been great, been contacted multiple times since the purchase to make sure I received them and to see if there were any problems to resolve. There has been no problems to date. Shears seem to be decent quality, but I have not used them much at all at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Blacksheep

customer_reviews.title: Used multiple times survived cleaning in both bleach and Cidex.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for use in a clinic setting. I have used just about every brand of shear available. After weeks of sterilizing they would fall apart. These have been great they've held up to the rigorous cleaning, and harsh chemicals used between patients. They cut through inches of Kerlex, Coban, Ace bandages like butter through a knife!
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsee24

customer_reviews.title: I just received these shears a few days ago but ...
customer_reviews.text: I just received these shears a few days ago but they seem to be true to the advertising and the comments of others. I go back to work tonight and will use them and will get back to you.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Kiefer

customer_reviews.title: They are almost as nice as the other premium EMT shears that cost twice ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of Surviveware Trauma EMT Shears for my Trauma kits. They do everything as advertised. They are almost as nice as the other premium EMT shears that cost twice as much. It is a good idea to have several shears around the house, office, car, gear bag, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dean K.

customer_reviews.title: Cutting
customer_reviews.text: I only used the shears 3 times at work and now they won't cut anything. Not sure why they went dull.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Tapia

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty scissors
customer_reviews.text: Woah these bad boys can cut thru anything! They cut thru cardboard and I was impressed. I'm a nurse and I definitely would say it's a must in a nurse's pocket
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my job
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my job! Sturdy, will cut through anything, very strong. I highly recommend these trauma shears. I have had many different pairs of trauma shears, working in a Trauma ICU for 15 years, and these are the best most durable pair I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Deanne

customer_reviews.title: Very Dull Shears
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. I'm an ER nurse and the first time I tried these shears out was trying to cut through a cotton t-shirt on a trauma patient and these shears couldn't do it. Later on I tried to use them to take off a paper wristband and it couldn't even do that...
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Vollmer

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice shears. I really enjoyed using them during the special event.
customer_reviews.author: Velvet Liedkie

customer_reviews.title: Do not work
customer_reviews.text: I am an ED resident and these shears simply do not cut. I will be sticking to the Madison supply brand of shears, which cut well and are the same price.
customer_reviews.author: titanosaur

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior citizen now, but in my youth I was an EMT. There is nothing better than trauma shears even now around the house. They last forever and are strong yet safe.
customer_reviews.author: DebbieB

customer_reviews.title: Larger than I needed.
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely for trauma - I have found mine useful for opening those pesky plastic sealed items that China loves to pack items in. I am sure if a trauma arises I will be suitably supplied - but I did find a smaller bandage scissors that are more useful for my needs elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Will cut through anything
customer_reviews.text: I have wrapping on my legs that must be changed regularly. Regular scissors really can't cut through the wraps, but these sure do. These are great scissors. They make a tough job easy. My wife loves them.
customer_reviews.author: TommyT

customer_reviews.title: Need to have for medical, hunting, traveling kit
customer_reviews.text: Great product and cleans up well. I use for Cutting everything.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Good for bigger hands
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend is a nurse and these work great for him bc they are bigger and more comfortable for him. A lot of the medical shears are smaller and not great for men’s hands
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Best for money and tactical
customer_reviews.text: Best for your money, In all the years as a paramedic and police officer I have used many pairs of shears. These by far are most durable and solid that I have used
customer_reviews.author: David Graham

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Good shears got the job done until I purchased better ones
customer_reviews.author: Oshia

customer_reviews.title: nice large handle for my son as fits well in ...
customer_reviews.text: nice large handle for my son as fits well in his hand he is lefty but uses his right hand also when an emergency happens love these .
customer_reviews.author: patty meininger

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Sharp. Easy to use. Can cut through rolled gauze easily
customer_reviews.author: Emjay328

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Good to keep a pair in your first aid kit
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shear scissors for nursing school and even though I haven’t had to use them I can tell they are going to be awesome. As soon as I opened the package I could tell that the quality was great! Also customer service is awesome, they checked to make sure I had received my item and then checked to make sure they are working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Lizett Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: lightweight but heavy duty shears
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shears. My legs are triple wrapped twice a week and these shears cut through these heavy bandages as if they were paper. Very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have
customer_reviews.text: These shears are great, I would recommend them to anyone. My little boy has special needs and they come in really handy to cut surgical tape or packs of stuff he needs, I also use them in the plants as a rigger to cut zip-ties or fire blanket and never have to worry if they will be sturdy enough or sharp enough.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t field tested yet.
customer_reviews.text: Just got them. Seem tight and sharp. Cut one piece of cloth cut fine. Haven’t tried them in the field yet.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Jamroz

customer_reviews.title: Durable, reliable, and light.
customer_reviews.text: I work in an OR and abused my old shears, these shears work great! Plan on ordering more for my team and my hiking first-aid kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Wife absolutely loves them, and the company is amazing to deal with! Would and will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for price!
customer_reviews.text: Use these daily for work. Very sharp, good quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Shae

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Quality product and superb customer service. I received a hand written thank you card with the purchase in addition to a follow up email to ensure I was satisfied with the product. Would highly recommend! Thanks to the entire Surviveware team for such a great experience!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron D

customer_reviews.title: Best Trauma Sheers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size, super sharp and strong! My absolute favorite pair, and for a good price!
customer_reviews.author: BreyAnna Hanson

product_meta.title: Surviveware Trauma & Bandage Shears - 7.5 Inches for Nurses and EMTs
feature_bullets: NO DAMAGE TO SKIN. These shears cut anything, except skin. Why? Our scissors are engineered & made with a blunt tip so you can safely remove clothing from the patient without causing any damage. Are you looking to upgrade your first aid kit? Safely cut gauze, splints, bandages, jeans and even seat belts during emergencies.

JAPANESE STAINLESS STEEL BLADES. Our blades are made with patented Japanese steel blades, covered with a protective fluoride coating. The strongest blades are crucial during an emergency. Cut clothes in an instant and get to work, fast. Furthermore, the milled serrations edged into the blades allow effortless cutting.

AUTOCLAVABLE. If you are in the ER room you need a tool you can use again and again. Our shears are autoclavable at 143 degrees so you can sterilize your equipment safely. With ergonomic and comfortable handles it makes sense that our shears are so highly rated by emergency room personnel, trauma nurses and military paramedics.

TRUSTED BY PROFESSIONALS. Whether you are a nurse in training or a trained professional, make sure you are equipped with the right tools to get the job done. Be the go to person in your department and save lives.

STRONG AND DURABLE. Unlike other trauma shears out there, ours are strong enough to cut through the Combat Application Tourniquet, wet or dry bandages and even pennies. Watch our video to see these top of the line blades work their magic!
